Theophilus, the first book that I write was part of all of the things that Jesus does and all of the things that he teaches.~!~Title:[Proposition_Label] (NP Luke ) (VP write+s[Third_Singular_Present] ) (NP (AdjP another ) book ) . After Jesus died, God raised him from the dead. Then Jesus showed the apostles that he was alive. He proved to the disciples many times that he was alive. After Jesus was raised from the dead, he was on the earth for forty days. The apostles saw Jesus many times during those forty days. And Jesus spoke to the disciples about God's kingdom during those forty days.

One day while Jesus was eating with the apostles, he told them to stay in Jerusalem. He said to the apostles, “Wait here until you receive the gift that the Father promised you that he would send to you. Remember that previously I told you about this gift.~!~one_day [ while (NP Jesus ) (VP was[Pre-Verbal] eat+ing[Participle] ) (NP with the[Pre-Nominal] apostle+s[Plural] ) , ] (NP he ) (VP told ) (NP them ) [ (NP ) (VP to[Pre-Verbal] stay ) (NP in Jerusalem ) ] . After Jesus said these things, he was lifted from the earth to the sky. Jesus entered a cloud while the apostles watched him be lifted. Then the apostles were not able to see Jesus.
The apostles were staring at the sky where Jesus went. Suddenly two men who were wearing white clothes were standing beside the apostles.

These men said, “Men who are from Galilee, why are you standing here? Why are you looking at the sky? You saw Jesus carrying to heaven. Jesus will return from the sky to the earth.”~!~(NP these[Pre-Nominal] men ) (VP said ) [ ,_“ (NP men [ who[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP are ) (NP from Galilee ) ] , ) (NP (AdvP why ) ) (VP are[CP-VP] ) (NP you ) (VP stand+ing[Participle] ) (NP here ) ? ] . Title: A new apostle is chosen. Then the apostles returned from the Mount of Olives to Jerusalem. This mountain is about one half mile from Jerusalem.

After the apostles entered the city, they went to the room where they were staying. They were Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James, who was Alphaeus' son, Simon, whom people called ‘Zealot’, and Judas, who was James' son.~!~[ after (NP the[Pre-Nominal] apostle+s[Plural] ) (VP entered ) (NP the[Pre-Nominal] city ) , ] (NP they ) (VP went ) (NP to the[Pre-Nominal] room [ where[Relativizer] (NP they ) (VP were[Pre-Verbal] stay+ing[Participle] ) (NP ) ] ) . (Money was paid to Judas to do these things. Then Judas bought a field. But he fell down in that field. And Judas' body burst. Then Judas' intestines came out from his body.
And all of the people who lived in Jerusalem heard that Judas died. So they named that field Akeldama. Akeldama means ‘field of blood’.)

Then Peter said, “The Holy Spirit wrote about these things to the book named Psalms. The Holy Spirit wrote, “People shouldn't go near that man's land. And people shouldn't live on that land.” The Holy Spirit also wrote, “Allow another man to do that man's work.” Footnote: The Holy Spirit wrote these things in Psalms 69:25 and in Psalms 109:8.~!~then (NP Peter ) (VP said ) [ ,_“ (NP the[Pre-Nominal] Holy_Spirit ) (VP wrote ) (NP about these[Pre-Nominal] thing+s[Plural] ) (NP to the[Pre-Nominal] book (NP named Psalms ) ) ] . Then the apostles used lots to choose one of these two men. The lots showed the apostles that the Lord chose Matthias. So Matthias became an apostle. Then Matthias started working with the 11 other apostles.

The book named Acts. When Luke started writing this book, he wrote about Jesus, who became alive again. And Luke told us that God caused Jesus to become very important. Jesus is the king of the earth. Jesus promised his disciples that he would send the Holy Spirit.The book named the Acts.
